{"step_by_step_thinking": "The sensory innervation of the tongue is divided into two parts. The anterior two-thirds of the tongue is primarily innervated by the VII cranial nerve, also known as the facial nerve. The posterior one-third of the tongue, however, is innervated by the IX cranial nerve, also known as the glossopharyngeal nerve.", "answer_choice": "B. IX cranial nerve"}
